Reviews.Title: “Great Unique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kathy T
Reviews.Content: We travel for work and I'm constantly looking for new and intersting places to stay. The Inn at The Black Olive was perfect. I didn't feel like I was stuck in another hotel but rather staying somewhere fun and relaxing. The location was amazing and the beds are really comfortable. The restaurant upstairs was excellent. Everyone was really nice and helpful. i only had a few thoughts that weren't totally positive, but they in no way will keep me from staying there every time we're in Baltimore for work. The TV in the living room was on the smaller side. As I don't watch TV a lot that doesn't really matter to me. There was no dock or stereo hookup for an ipod. Would have been nice, but again, I wasn't there to just sit in the room for hours. They only carried glass bottles for water. I get why for sure but it would have been nice to have something more easy to carry outside the hotel. Maybe have water bottles in the room that they can charge for?

Reviews.Title: “Heaven!”
Reviews.Author: Beyond_all_Borders
Reviews.Content: Thanks to Hotel.com our reservation at a different hotel was misplaced, and so they put us up in a Corner Spa Suite at the Black Olive while attending the Natural Products Expo. I can't tell you how nice it was to finally be in a comfortable and green hotel environment. We enjoyed all the comforts of being home (organic food and personal/bath products), a comfortable bed, living room, and kitchen. We loved the corner balcony and whirlpool. The location was convenient to many restaurants and shops and the staff was super helpful and friendly. As a former architect I really could appreciate all the time they put into making sure every detail was green and efficient - even down to the way they clean the rooms with steam! Thank you for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal Stay”
Reviews.Author: Raven C
Reviews.Content: I previously shared a review with you as TheBirthdayGirl45, however since then I had another opportunity to stay at the Inn at the Black Olive and let me tell you it was phenomenal. My friend who has expressed to me how clean the Inn is and me being a traveler, part-time travel agent and a person with high standards who has stayed in some of the finest hotels found that hard to believe every hotel has somes dust in the corners.  Now my first visit here in March I thoroughly inspected the place, however  I didn't do my how clean is this room test so when I went back this month I decided to challenge him on his review of the Inn. I took with me a pair of brand new white socks and I wore them in the room for 10 hours before I took them off well to my surprise my brand new white socks were still white when I took them off I couldn't believe it. I then went around the room and did the dust bunny test I went through this room with a fine tooth comb and could not find any dust anywhere...very impressive since I have stayed in many hotels, resorts, private rental homes and my biggest complaint is that the room is never cleaned properly this is a big deal for me especially if I'm spending my money to stay there.  Well this lovely Organic Greek setting Inn is like apartment living as soon as you enter the rooms the lights come on immediately so there's no looking around for a light switch. The bed/mattress, towels and robes are organic; soft to the skin and the furniture is made of bamboo and recovered wood the walls are my favorite simply because they are not dry wall Dimitris kept the natural look yea I did my homework...I had some free time. Did I also mention that the floors are radiant heated so if you forget your slippers they got you covered. Complimentary organic breakfast, wine, water, and coffee are all available to you in room. Awesome!! Look I could go on all day talking about this place, but why should I if you don't believe me go check it out for yourself I guarantee you, you will not be disappointed. The staff is very friendly beyond friendly...many thanks to Dimitris, Chris, Alicia, Jenny, Emily and Ryan  if I excluded anyone or misspelled your names please forgive me, but I didn't want to end this review without acknowledging all of you.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: oliviaderaadt
Reviews.Content: Ryan Solomon, the concierge and director of customer relations, is phenomenal in every way. He went above and beyond his traditional duties as a concierge to make sure we were extremely comfortable and very informed about our room and its amenities throughout our brief stay in Baltimore. The restaurant is also amazing. Great service and great Greek-inspired/Mediterranean food. This is an awesome place to stay whether you are a prospective student looking at Johns Hopkins or looking for somewhere to stay for a weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Treat Yourself to a Stay at this Lovely Inn!”
Reviews.Author: Donna W
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the pleasure of spending a luxurious night at The Inn at the Black Olive on April 6, 2012. Traveling to downtown Baltimore for the Oriole’s Opening Day, we thought we would treat ourselves to a night at this lovely, boutique-style inn. Our experience was absolutely wonderful from start to finish! From the moment we arrived, we were treated like royalty. The manager, Alicia, personally escorted us to our suite to make sure we were pleased with our room and to explain the abundant amenities that the room had to offer. The Black Olive Inn’s eco-friendly décor includes not only organic toiletries and bed linens, but also a complimentary bottle of organic wine. As guests, we were given numerous healthy choices for our breakfast the following morning which was delivered to our room promptly at the time we had requested in advance. We were impressed with the spaciousness and cleanliness of the suite, with a large living and dining area, bedroom, and bathroom with a two-person Jacuzzi and large enclosed shower. The bed was so inviting, with soft, organic sheets and bed linens which enveloped you in sheer comfort and allowed you to easily drift off to sleep. For guests traveling on business, their large, flat-screen television also serves as a computer with internet access. The only suggestion for improvement which I shared with the inn’s friendly and courteous director of customer relations, Ryan, would be to place a small sitting stool under the vanity in the bathroom so that guests may comfortably use the nice make-up mirror they provide. This is the perfect place for health-conscious, eco-friendly enthusiasts to spend an evening, weekend, or as much time as their visit to Baltimore allows them. It is great for a romantic getaway and also for the business traveler. The inn is very customer-service oriented and makes sure every need of every guest is met. We highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely, friendly boutique hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Boomer634
Reviews.Content: Our son was married in Baltimore, and many members of the wedding party and friends stayed at the Inn at The Black Olive. The friendly staff went out of their way to cater to all our needs, and the store/cafe downstairs made various delicious organic and sustainable foodstuffs. All the spacious suites had views of the harbor, and being in the Fells Point area, there were many restaurants and cute shops to visit. I would recommend this Inn to anyone who wants to be treated like royalty.

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Thebirthdaygirl45
Reviews.Content: First let me start off by saying this is one of the most beautiful hotels I have ever stayed in. All of the Staff was so friendly when I arrived I was greeted by Emily (so sweet)...she gave me my room key that my friend had left at the front desk for me. I then took the elevator to the fourth floor where I was greeted by some of the most unique art work I actually took a minute admiring the art before I went to our room. Once I arrived in the room I could not believe how spacious it was simply gorgeous. My friend had arrived before so he was already in the room and was very familiar with the hotel. Our hotel room was very spacious from the livingroom to the bedroom to the bathroom. The bathroom has a 2 seater hot tub and the shower was so spacious no hitting the wall in there unless you wanted to :)). My friend and I just stood at the large balcony windows admiring the scenery it was so calming and relaxing honestly I did not want to leave. We enjoyed a nice lunch and breakfast during our stay and even stopped by the market to pickup some organic drinks and lunch for him that day. Inn at The Black Olive you have spoiled me this is the only hotel I want to stay in and on that note I am already trying to book our next stay. Thank you Chris for such a wonderful stay you made me feel so special! :)) The Birthday Girl

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS, This is a hotel not to miss!!!”
Reviews.Author: Islandia888
Reviews.Content: Perfect get-away! I came to this hotel for a birthday treat and what a treat it was! Everything was spectacular - I walked in and was instantly relaxed by the beautiful colors and the spacious design. I loved the balconies; they provided a perfect space to watch the sun set. I appreciated the welcoming wine as well as the complimentary breakfast served in the room the next day. I tried both the shower and the jacuzzi during my stay - both were fabulous! The towels and robe that were provided were wonderful - Turkish towels? I cannot remember the brand, but they were fabulous - clearly the hotel management has carefully researched every product that they have in their rooms. The bedding, the soaps, the little chocolates by the bed - everything was perfect. I can't stress this enough. Lastly, the room was immaculate. Cleanliness is very important to me, and I did not find one speck of dust! My compliments to their cleaning staff. I have told my friends and co-workers about my experience - this hotel is truly not to be missed! Put this on your list for the perfect Baltimore retreat!

Reviews.Title: “Authenticity at it's finest.”
Reviews.Author: M L
Reviews.Content: The Inn at the Black Olive is a beautiful gem in the Charm City. From the impeccable details to the personal attention of the staff, every minute of our stay was spent in luxurious comfort. Our evening began with dinner on the outdoor terrace of the Olive Room, located on the rooftop of the inn. The grilled rock fish with wine pairing was thoroughly enjoyed. Our suite was quiet, spacious and uncluttered. The relaxation began immediately as the stunning view of the harbor and the stillness of the water settled in around us. The wonderful, comfortable bed after a healing soak in the hydrotherapy tub made sleep blissful. Every detail has been thought of...personalized check in, soft, organic robes and towels and private balconies. The green nature of the inn is an added and welcome bonus. Don't miss Jenny's healthy "green drink" from the Agora Market, located on the first floor of the inn. We will return to indulge our senses again.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in a family atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Julian A
Reviews.Content: Having one of the best seafood dinners ever at the restaurant "The Black Olive", Dimitris Spiliadis convinced me to switch hotels and come stay at the Inn at The Black Olive. This very personal invitation is exemplary for the whole atmosphere and experience at the inn. While the enormous suites equipped with all luxury common for at least 4 stars can easily compete with the big hotels around Baltimore downtown, staying at the Black Olive Inn still always feels like you are visiting a Greek family that just happens to have quite a big house. All staff is extremely friendly - and I don't mean "customer service friendly", but true and heartfelt friendliness with personal interest. The cherry on top is that this is one of the rare places that commits completely to being environmentally friendly and truly organic, from the building materials to the food quality. Truly one of the best hotel experiences ever for me!

Reviews.Title: “B&B European Hotel Cross In Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: jdocBaltimore
Reviews.Content: The Black Olive Inn is a cross between a B&B and a small European style hotel. It is located in the historic Fells Point neighborhood of Baltimore and close to the water but still within walking distance of the CBD. The staff are incredibly friendly and accommodating and our meal came with a full breakfast. Rooms are large done in a modern and eco friendly style and all have balconies and water views, walk-in showers and whirlpool tubs big enough for two. It took a while to get use to the energy saving remote control lights but otherwise we had a delightful visit. There is a european market and Greek restaurant with bar on site and the truly outstanding Black Olive restaurant operated by the same family is just around the corner. I highly recommend the Inn at the Black Olive and believe you will find it far from the typical hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Get Away”
Reviews.Author: Meg G
Reviews.Content: We toured the Inn at the Black Olive last summer after an enjoyable meal at the Black Olive restaurant in Fells Point. We booked a weekend in Early March that night. We liked the concept of a “green facility” we really liked the comfort of the inn. The staff is exceptional. Every person we encountered was friendly, helpful, polite, and warm. We stayed in the VIP suite and the rooms were large and comfortable. The attention to detail is shown by the comfort and the excellence in service and quality. One wall of our suite overlooked the harbor. The weather cooperated and we were walking distance from Fells Point, and other harbor attractions. The restaurant on top of the inn has a great Sunday brunch with live jazz combo provided by students of the Peabody Institute of Music along with a beautiful view of the harbor. Original paintings and photography decorated the rooms and hallways warming the industrial feel of the building. The market on the first floor had a good selection of wine and food. We are looking forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Above and Beyond”
Reviews.Author: SebringGardenias
Reviews.Content: The past weekend at the Black Olive Inn was a delightful experience. The food was fantastic; the entire staff was charming and helpful beyond our expectations. The room was immaculate. We enjoyed the food in the restaurant and cafe. Aromatherapy bath accessories were an additional treat after walking around the city and exploring Historical Fells Point. Above all, every staff member was gracious and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Stay”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Inn at The Black Olive 2/16/12, and absolutely loved it. This is such a charming, quiet, and very clean hotel. The room was beautifully decorated with local art and live plants. The bed was extremely comfortable in a spacious bedroom, separate from the living and dining area. We appreciated the free bottle of Greek wine and eco-friendly toiletries. The market has scrumptious fresh baked bread and Greek olive oil, not to mention awesome coffee with organic creamer. Staff were exceptionally polite, helpful, and professional. We have plans to come back very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Belated Valentine's Day”
Reviews.Author: PRFScott
Reviews.Content: Neat little hotel in Fell's Point - organic, trendy, environmentally friendly Parking was great - in and out for free all day - we did not use since we walked but was great. Front Desk - attentive and friendly Meals - breakfast - the 5th floor dining room seemed a bit unprepared for our arrival but the food was good. Agora market and the smell of fresh bread was awesome. Overall service was great considering the size of the hotel - I called for cream for coffee - it arrived so quickly. Door opened arriving Bed was the greatest of all time and the spa was very great! Only "complaint" and I use that term slightly - the geothermal heat could not get the room to the appropriate temperature - set thermoset at 80 - room was like 72 and the floor had some cold spots. Would stay again -

Reviews.Title: “Welcome Home Stay”
Reviews.Author: kennethgordon
Reviews.Content: I recently traveled to Baltimore, MD to have surgery at Johns Hopkins. This involved a seven night hotel stay. We chose The Inn at The Black Olive, where we had stayed on a two day "get acquainted" trip to the hospital. The Inn is brand new, but it had a very homelike quality. We were drawn to the hotel's "green" claims, all of which were true. The organic bed had my wife raving about the best sleep in years. Even more important was the hospitality ethic that was shared by every employee we encountered. There was nothing they wouldn't do to enhance our stay. I returned to the hotel after 36 hours in the hospital and was "Welcome Home". I never felt so glad to be in a hotel. We had a suite the allowed me to comfortably convalesce without being in bed. The staff constantly offered to bring meals etc. up to me. Before the operation my wife and I were easily able to walk all over the Fells Point district, take the water taxi around the harbor, and walk to a wide choice of great restaurants. And it was a very short ride to Johns Hopkins. I heartily recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Baltimore. And they were very willing to meet our needs on rate.

Reviews.Title: “An Amazing Evening in Fells Point, MD”
Reviews.Author: Steve C
Reviews.Content: Recently I took up the opportunity to stay at the newest addition to my favorite part of Baltimore - The Inn at the Black Olive in beautiful Fells Point. I am a Baltimore native and was so happy to be warmly greeted in this super clean, open, and aroma rich building that had a very Mediterranean feel permeating from the moment we walked in. The cafe allowed for a quick browsing of wines, a sample of hummus, and a nice place to get adjusted before heading to our room. The room was very large. The open spaces, the art on the wall, the music that was playing when we entered were all chosen with taste and our comfort in mind. The bedroom was private, quiet, and had a bed that trumps all other beds! The bathroom was equally spacious with a tub that resembled a small pool and a shower that (as a guy I take shorter showers) was hard to get out of because it was so luxurious. I have stayed in many of my hometown hotels and B&Bs, and without a doubt I will no longer be needing any of those places because I'm nominating the Inn at the Black Olive as my dream home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Surprising Oasis”
Reviews.Author: G d
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with the service and friendliness of the staff at the Black Olive. They were so welcoming and bent over backwards to be incredible hosts. Comfortable bed! Great bathtub! View is mixed--It's of the water, but there's also a big empty lot in front of it. That would be the only downside. Other than that, it was really a great experience. I would go back again and again. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Our Stay at the Inn”
Reviews.Author: Sherron L
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved the Inn. The customer service, the room, everything was the absolute greatest. Food was excellent all organic. All rooms are suites with living room, bedroom and bath. The bathroom had a Sanijet Spa tub and large shower.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: Nicole E
Reviews.Content: Great service. Awesome staff. Perfect location. Walkable to Fells Point, Canton, Inner Harbor and route 83 if you need to drive anywhere else in the city. Beautiful suite. Like a home away from home. Very clean, comfortable, well designed and fun. Best mattress ever. White fluffy comforter. Eco-friendly. Gay-friendly. Well priced. I can't say enough about this place. Also, the Black Olive restaurant is amazing. Anyone planning a trip or long weekend in Baltimore should stay here.

Reviews.Title: “What a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tom N
Reviews.Content: I've been visiting Tripadvisor often when picking out hotels or restaurants to go to. Never have I been anywhere though that compelled me enough to create an account and actually leave a review. What a destination! I would never expect a hotel like this in Baltimore of all Cities, but to be honest with you, with the hotel staff's recommendations I was able to see a different more fun side of the city. The best thing about this hotel is that the staff are true locals. Everyone knows the top destinations and how to get there. We got lucky the weather was amazing in the middle of january so we got to truly enjoy the harbor. Then there is the Olive Room. I am astonished at the change I've seen at this restaurant. At first i went about three weeks ago. It was a not so hot experience and seemed kinda empty. I believe there must have been a change in management or something because going there again last week was a real treat. There was this gentleman running around making sure everything was flawless, I thought he was just a really dedicated busser, waiter, bartender extraordinaire. Turns out he was the OWNER! Great restaurant to compliment the black olive. Yet I honestly feel the true heart and soul was the hotel. This is honestly the best hotel staff I have ever MET! You know why? Because they actually take time to make sure you meet them. They will sit and talk with you and joke around and they are constantly wondering if everything was PERFECT not good but PERFECT. This staff is inspired in a way I have never seen before. They are dedicated with all their should to be number 1 and it shows. I had a great time talking with Ahmed and Ryan. Ryan was very professional and and kind. Ahmed gave us amazing directions and made sure that we were visiting the must see's in baltimore. Also we had dinner at the Olive Room and lunch at the Black Olive. The last night we wanted something other than Greek cuisine and wanted to take a walk around town. Ahmed gave us a long list of recommendations, but after explaining our preferences, he made us a reservation at to one of his top baltimore restaurants Tio Pepe's. We looked around on reviews didn't find much, but decided to trust his judgement. He was right amazing food, these type of recommendations can only be made by true Baltimorians and the Inn at the black olive has the best of them.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jilleien
Reviews.Content: The Inn at the Black Olive is hands down one of the best places I have ever stayed. The room was great, but what really pushed it over the top was the staff. I was amazed by their attention to detail and their upbeat attitude. Ryan was excellent. While he was helping me bring in my bags he noticed I had a bottle of champagne. When I came back in my room there were two champagne glasses on the table and a single flower by them! I can not say enough great things about my stay! I am in love with this place!

Reviews.Title: “Inn at the Black Olive”
Reviews.Author: craig m
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the overall stay at the Inn. We stayed one night so we can enjoy the city. The Inn is in a quite location and has a unique appearance and likeness. The staff was very pleasant and friendly. The location was close to Little Italy and other harbor activities, just a cab ride away. We were greeted with a bottle of wine. The room was good and had an awesome bathtub for a couple to enjoy. The breakfast was simple and good. And there was free valet parking. All these added to the ultimate value of the hotel. I will also add they are military friendly offering a good discount for the room. There were a few things that could easily be fixed. The bed seemed a little loose and squeaked (easy fix) and the air handler seemed a little loud. Overall, I would return and may do that this summer for another night out!

Reviews.Title: “Nice spot, great organic market!!”
Reviews.Author: Ahmad I
Reviews.Content: Well, first of all I thoroughly enjoyed the immediate greeting from the gentleman at the reception desk. Although a small not so symmetrical layout for an entrance, my attention was quickly directed to the organic market to the right, which led me to questions and thank God I did. This young man was eager to let me know everything about the hotel and how they produce almost all their own energy!! Then he took me on a tour though the hotel, opining the door to every Mediterranean suite. All of which were amazing!! Finally ending where I wanted to go with my date, the roof-top restaurant. Amazing view, great service and an extremely helpful staff. Be very careful though. Its predominately greek style cuisine. So if you're looking for a ruth's chris, you won't find it here. Pretty much a greek menu, but soooo good. My date ended up wanting to stay the night there by the time we were done! Ive been back a few times since then, but have spreading the word on their great organic, well priced market.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Romantic Evening”
Reviews.Author: HappileeMarreed
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent one fantastic evening at the Inn for my birthday last weekend. We were given early check in and had time to get settled before lunch at the Olive Room. (Also wonderful!) We stayed in a corner king room that was so spacious! The room included a comfortable couch and TV area, dining area with wet bar and fridge, huge bathroom, and large bedroom. Beautiful artwork decorated the hallways as well as our room. We used the tub and complimentary sea salts for an afternoon soak while we drank the complimentary bottle of wine. In the afternoon we visited the market on the first floor and bought some delicious cheese for an evening snack. The bed was very comfortable and we had a great night's sleep. In the morning we ordered greek yogurt and fruit for the included breakfast. The yogurt was topped with honey and what tasted like the inside of baklava. Delicious! The Inn's location is great. We dined at Charleston's which is just a 3 block walk. The Inn is basically between Inner Harbor East and Fell's Point. There is so much to do within walking distance. Everyone at the Inn from Emily at the front desk to the smiling UMBC student who we talked to at the market was so friendly and helpful. We will definitely be back and have already recommended the Inn to friends.

Reviews.Title: “The Inn at The Black Olive, comfort, space and "green"”
Reviews.Author: Maria F
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Inn, usually we stay at the Marriott a few blocks away which is holiding an event, wedding, or some other gathering which means a lot of noise and drunk people in the hallways at all hours. The Inn was conveniently located walking distance to Fells Point, Harbor East, and the Inner Harbor. Breakfast was delicious, fresh squeezed oj, greek yogurt with fruit, and a nice view from the rooftop restaurant. I had a cold and sore throat and upon asking for some salt to make a salt water gargle, the staff immediately offered organic sea salt and a mouth rinse from the store for me to try. They were extremely hospitable and accomodating. The bath products were lovely and so was the complimentary bottle of organic Greek wine in the fridge. The room is spacious and comfortable, and we enjoyed the free Netflix on the flat screen tv. We will be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing...a must visit!”
Reviews.Author: SGH926
Reviews.Content: Everything was absolutely perfect. Our new favorite Inn.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT ROMANTIC GETAWAY!”
Reviews.Author: Linda W
Reviews.Content: I booked a surprise getaway evening at the Inn at the Black Olive for my husband. The entire experience was amazing! The staff was extremely friendly and helpful! The room was clean, spacious, and inviting! All the little extras...complimentary bottle of wine, organic products, and breakfast added such a nice touch! We enjoyed every moment of our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Delight for the senses”
Reviews.Author: tesiab
Reviews.Content: From the moment you walk into the reception, you are greeted with the aroma of fresh baked bread and a hint of all the yumminess that's to come from a stay at The Black Olive. They have clearly put a lot of thought and effort into the total experience. Everything is organic, from the beds to the sea salts for the tub, and even the bottle of wine that comes with the room. The rooms are basically mini apartments - they're huge. The jacuzzi tub and shower are beautiful and super clean. Wifi and streaming Netflix are also included in the room, which is nice. The staff was very friendly and seemed willing to bend over backwards to make for the best stay possible. And the Fells Point location is fabulous. The only suggestion I might have would be to add a small make-up light over the mirror in the bathroom. The overhead lighting in there is a little less than flattering, but totally not a big deal. We ate at The Black Olive restaurant around the corner form the hotel. We didn't realize it wasn't in the same building when we made our reservation, and probably would have opted for the Olive Room on the 5th floor if we'd known that, since it was cold a rainy the night we stayed, but the food was excellent. Pricey, for sure, but delicious. We'd definitely go back and highly recommend the Inn to anyone staying in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “"The" # 1 Hotel in Baltimore!!”
Reviews.Author: HendersonsManager
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed two nights while on business in Baltimore. Wow!! What a fabulous hotel. I cannot say enough wonderful things about this "green" property. From the delightful staff to the incredible rooms with every amenity you could desire. What a refeshing addition to Baltimore. Bravo!!

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST!!!”
Reviews.Author: deets1162
Reviews.Content: I just returned from staying at the Black Olive for 8 nights and it was the BEST experience I have ever had at a hotel. There is NO OTHER place to stay when in Baltimore! My suite was large and spacious. The staff began for my arrival the day before by having my heated floor ready when I arrived along with wonderful organic chocolate and bath salts!! I was in TOTAL HEAVEN!!! I live in Hawaii and I KNOW paradise when I see it and theBLack Olive is great. Ryan was wonderful in assisting me and giving me trips around the city (Ryan, I ahve tried 4 times now to make the white pizza at BOP and its not the same), Jenny and DImitri wwere so good making me green drinks and telling me about how they live green. Alicia was always there for me to come to as well with a quesiton about the city and my whereabouts. The staff is superior and you can tell the whole operation is an family event. People who work there are invested in doing a good job. The bed was wonderful and I slept for 10 hours in it straight!! Which is not what I do at home!!I will be returning to Baltimore every 4-6 moths for the next 3-4 years and I can PROMISE I will be staying there!!!

Reviews.Title: “A great oasis!”
Reviews.Author: Linnda
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful getaway that is not far away from DC - and is a worthy destination from anywhere. If hotels around the world followed even one of the many eco principles of the Inn at Black Olive, the planet would be a better place. Happily, the welcome book narrative in this 12-room hotel identifies the elements and source of bedding, furniture and also its design and build. The Inn marries Greek traditions and generous hospitality with modern - yet timeless - elements. It is a close walk to the heart of historic Fells Point and other parts in Charm City Baltimore. It is a great oasis during a long trip for travellers up or down I-95. On the subject of hospitality: We checked-in on a busy Saturday night with 5 minutes to spare to meet an 8:00 PM dinner reservation located several blocks away. The concierge drove our car to the restaurant and then valet parked it back at the hotel. Incredible! We had a nice walk back and the car key was tucked away at the front desk. I've been to many hotels around the world, and would never have considered this service as an option The Inn at Black Olive is a great place to be. Just go!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Bailey C
Reviews.Content: We stayed the at this hotel for a mini in town get away for our anniversary and we could not have been more pleased! This hotel had thought of everything! From a very easy check in to the organic wine and jetted tub...along we a very comfortable bed and great location we could not have asked for more! We cannot wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place”
Reviews.Author: Greg C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn at the Black Olive for a quick night out of town. The staff was extremely attentive to our needs as mentioned by other reviewers and saw to it that all aspects of our stay were pleasant. The rooms are exceptionally large and the bedding as I'm sure has been mentioned by others, is top notch. We had noticed from the hotel website that it had received a LEED Platinum rating http://www.usgbc.org/LEED , which interested me as a construction professional, as I didn't think that would be possible in a hotel design. The staff explained many of the design and construction decisions in detail. It was terribly interesting and perhaps most importantly, the results of these decisions didn't have a negative effect on the comfort of the accommodations as one unfamiliar with the process might be inclined to think, in fact if anything it improved the comfort level through high quality bedding and furnishings, and improved indoor air quality among other things. Also, the location can't be beat -- close enough to the heart of Fell's Point to ensure you have access to night life, restaurants, and a pleasant environment for walking around, but not so close that the night life is happening right outside your window. The only recommendation I could make to improve the settings would be to add some soft textured wall covering to some of the interior room walls as the high ceilings and large spaces tended to make for a somewhat reverberant environment. All in all though, i can't imagine staying anywhere else in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Find!”
Reviews.Author: Robin R
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the opportunity to stay at the Inn at The Black Olive with some friends and what an amazing place. From the wine upon our arrival, to the luxurious sheets on the bed, the Egyptian cotton towels, and the unbelievable amenities in the bathroom, our stay was terrific!! It was so nice having this truly Green facility in such a wonderful location. Very easy to walk to many close by destinations. Ryan at the Inn made our stay so special. He made sure that we had everything that we needed and was always availalbe to help us. Thank you Ryan!! Everything and everyone at the Inn at The Black Olive was truly spectacular!! Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Such a Special Place”
Reviews.Author: Lynne W
Reviews.Content: Just a special place and experience in many, many ways. There was no request or need that went unmet by the staff, and everyone went out of there way to make sure we had everything we needed. The room was great and large, comfortable, and a complete respite. The food was organic and very, very good. You cannot find better food any where in Baltimore in either the Olive Room or The Black Olive restaurant. The emphasis on organic is also special and carried through in every aspect. My 86-year-old mother has wanted to travel around the world, after staying here, she is ready to move into the inn instead. Thank you for creating such a special place! Lynne White

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay in A Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: Diane M
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay in this "green" property..beginning with the Organic Wine that was awaiting us as we entered the room. The amazing bathtub, bath salts, soft as can be towels and extremely comfortable beds and pillows made this small inn extra-special. The local Zeke's coffee and morning breakfast was delicious. Warm scones and fresh squeezed OJ was the perfect beginning to our day. Walk to Harbor East and throughout Fells Pt for fun shops, restaurants, bars, live music & lovely holiday lights this time of year. We loved the balcony and views of the boats and Harbor area.

Reviews.Title: “OMG - this was heaven!”
Reviews.Author: SailorII
Reviews.Content: We had an Engagement Party at the Olive Room (5th floor and terrace overlooking the City of Baltimore) recently and decided to stay at the Inn below. It was am amazing experience. We were only 30 seconds by elevator ride from the party, our room was spacious beyond belief and we had a spectacular view of the City. Our sitting room/living room came stocked with an amazing bottle of Greek Wine, we had a large refrigerator/kitchen area and everything was done with amazing style. Our separate bedroom was spacious with gorgeous art (that was for sale) oriental rugs - plenty of closet and drawer space. The bed was heavenly with at least 6 pillows, billowy sheets, so comfortable - had the best sleep ever until morning! The bathroom was in itself an experienc - with jacuzzi tub (the quietest ever - organic bath salts and products) and a huge shower (and hidden washer dryer) It was as large as a dressing room - with great lighting. The service was beyond compare and we had breakfast delivered the next morning - with a view of the city waking up... we would recommend this great Inn to anyone who wants a unique Baltimore experience. And for dinner - if the Black Olive Room upstairs is open - you will find the best food in the city... I cannot wait to go back there.. and if you are in town for Fourth of July or New Years - book it for a spectacular view of the Balitmore fireworks.. it is perfect in every way. The room was so big you could host a cocktail party there with four or five other couples and have plenty of room... It's not going to be Balitmore's Best Kept Secret for ever - make your reservations today for that special occasion or an amazing getaway! (as a postscript - we had a cocktail party (engagement party) upstairs for 65 people - and it was amazing - our guests were blown away by the food, the organic wine and beer, the service and the atmosphere) It was truly spectacular! The owners Pauline and Stelios Spiliadis were just fabulous people to work with - they know their way around event planning. The room holds 75 and would be great for any reception, engagement party, small Wedding, brunch or other event..

Reviews.Title: “BEST EXPERIENCE EVER!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: rcombaluzier
Reviews.Content: The place is great, the service and attention wonderful, rooms are spectacular, location and view are excellent, the concept cannot be better planed, and food…..Wooooooooooww the Food!!!!. If you go to Baltimore you can’t miss it, Its Defiantly a Most.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place”
Reviews.Author: daffy k
Reviews.Content: This place is really great. The service is wonderful, the food is delicious and the rooms are just fantastic. The staff are all great- I didn't have a single bad interaction with any of the staff members there and they all made me feel very welcomed and very good. Overall, I would definitely recommend this place to anyone coming to visit Baltimore or even if anyone just wants a nice little night away!

Reviews.Title: “SPECTACULAR! THE BEST!!!”
Reviews.Author: mintycastilla
Reviews.Content: We knew so little about baltimore and that did not change that much because we spent many hours in our great suit! when we first tasted the restaurant BLACK OLIVE we loved it but when we tasted the hotel, we fell in love with it! we absolutely loved the experience! I highly recommend it...it was such a delightful all of it: the marketplace downstairs, the restaurant around, the restaurant upstairs...but most of the suite! you really made my trip! thank you INN at the black olive!

Reviews.Title: “The BEST Organic/Green Hotel I've Ever Stayed At”
Reviews.Author: livingmaxwell
Reviews.Content: My experience at the Inn at The Black Olive was amazing. The service was phenomenal, the organic food was fantastic (organic food is impossible to find at most hotels), the eco-friendly amenities were spectacular and the room was HUGE. Yet, what impressed me the most was the personal attention from the staff. They all treated me like family, no request was too big and my satisfaction was their primary concern. I would never stay at any other hotel in Baltimore. The Inn at The Black Olive is a special place. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly!”
Reviews.Author: vkalterlong
Reviews.Content: My husband and I found the Inn at the Black Olive when looking for our first weekend getaway in three years (we have 2 boys under 2!). It was everything we needed and more! I cannot speak highly enough about every aspect of our stay at the Inn. Ryan at the front desk called us on our way asking which wine we would like in our room upon our arrival. Nighttime bath salts awaited us in the Sanijet tum. We had the California Spa Suite which had a wall of windows overlooking the bay, and at nearly 1000 square feet, felt like we were at a villa! Every detail of the room was well thought out to reflect the environmentally friendly mission of the Inn. While some may feel the furnishings and floor "sparce", we genuinely appreciated the attention to detail to ensure that this is a sustainable building. The only thing,we would recommend is that recycling bins/cans are added to each room to encourage the guests to make sure we keep up with purpose of the building. The bed was HEAVENLY and the blankets were heavy and cozy. Room service breakfast was delicious each morning with a hard-working attendant who was extremely friendly. In fact, EVERY person was incredibly helpful, friendly and attentive. Although this stay was not an inexpensive one, it was a worthy indulgence and one we would recommend to anyone looking for a boutique, eco-friendly experience. THANK YOU! -Vanessa and Ron

Reviews.Title: “Incredible food, service, rest and relaxation!”
Reviews.Author: TrekkingUSA
Reviews.Content: Located in the heart of Fells Point it's such a perfect location for walking around and taking in the sights and sounds of the Baltimore Harbor area, leisurely walking the brick-lined streets with old historic homes, and the simple joy of people-watching during the evening busy hours. The suite is very large (and still very new just opening a few months ago) and I know from talking to the inn keeper they are working to add more furnishings to give it a more cozy feel but anyone who appreciates true quality in furniture can see the pieces were chosen with much care in craftsmanship as well as sustainability. Everything from the hydrotherapy jet tub and the vegetable-based paints to the bamboo furniture and organic mattress and bedding. I didn't toss or turn and slept like a log until 8:30 in the morning which I never EVER do at hotels. It was pure heaven to sleep so well and feel so rested at a hotel. The tub, the bed and the food is enough reason to stay here! Oh yes the food... We ate at the Olive Room which was so incredibly delicious. The bread was addictive (thank goodness they sell that in their market). The grilled scallops & artichoke served with a delicate green salad was unbelievable and I can't wait to attempt to make it myself. For the main course I ordered the Platter of Four which was a generous sampling of Pork, Lamb, Chicken and Filet Mignon with slices of seasoned pita bread. Service was outstanding and the rooftop balcony offers a terrific view of the harbor. I will definitely come back when visiting Baltimore and highly recommend this hotel. It's always wonderful to feel so pampered.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Nora8907
Reviews.Content: When I found myself looking for a hotel for a last minute business trip I stumbled upon the Inn at the Black Olive and I could not be more thankful that I did. I travel to Baltimore quite frequently and typically stay in the Inner Harbor area, which is busy and bustling with tourists, but the Inn was in a perfect location! It's so close to everything yet in such a quaint neighborhood. The room was superb! So very spacious and the beds and jacuzzi were heavenly. I also love how every room gets a complimentary bottle of wine! This hotel is so green...everything from the soap provided to the food at the restaurant located in the hotel (which was AMAZING btw) is organic. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful!! I will definitely be returning to the Inn whenever I am in Baltimore in the future

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: rana s
Reviews.Content: one word : AMAZING! I stayed here with my husband for our anniversary and can say for sure we will be coming back for every anniversary coming. The service was phenomenal and the rooms were exquisite. We even extended our stay for an extra two nights. I really can not find any thing negative to say about our trip, besides the gloomy weather but did not mind staying in the room with the gorgeous view of the city (rainy and all). The days we did spend outside the hotel was definitely facilitated by the concierge. He (cant remember his name) helped us map out our days out so that we didn't miss anything. Dinner at the Black Olive was also delicious. We made the mistake of dinning out some where else the second night , and stuck to the Olive the remaining nights so we wouldn't be disappointed again...Baklava Ice cream is a must have! All their food is organic and delicately prepared. Can't wait to go back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: ibrahim1188
Reviews.Content: Everything from check-in to check-out was great! Very friendly staff that was more than willing to help with restaurant reservations, car service, entertainment and room service. Overall great experience. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful European Experience”
Reviews.Author: biztraveler457
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Inn on my last two business trips to Baltimore. Both times the service was excellent. The staff are friendly and warm. I felt a true European welcome. The rooms were quiet and comfortable with views of the harbor. After a good night sleep breakfast on the roof was a great way to start the day. I felt refreshed and energized. Next time I will bring my wife for a romantic weekend at Fells Point. There is a big bathtub in one of the rooms I stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Best concierge and green hotel, EVER!”
Reviews.Author: gretastic
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Black Olive was extremely helpful, welcoming and friendly. My friend and I came down for the night to experience Baltimore.The staff put us in Woody Harrelson's suite which was breathe taking. While we were invisible at other bars and restaurants the staff at the Black Olive did everything in their power to make our time there unforgettable. Anything we wanted they brought to us, if e needed to go somewhere they got us there, and when I needed to get my car from the garage they brought it to me. The complimentary bottle of wine and breakfast was amazing (we had the fresh fruit and yogurt and scones - you could taste the love baked into them.) The bed was so comfortable, the Sanijet pipeless whirlpool tub relieved all my aches, and the fact that everything was earth friendly made my smile even brighter.

Reviews.Title: “So nice!”
Reviews.Author: confusedtraveler
Reviews.Content: If you are deciding to go to Baltimore, do yourself a favor and stay at this inn. It is in Fells Point which is a very nice area and is a short walk to the touristy Inner Harbor area. The weekend we were there just happened to be the Fells Point Festival with lots of arts and crafts and eh itnic food booths. It was a fun time. There are lots of shops, bars and places to eat in Fells Point. The inn is right next to a parking garage which is extremely convenient. The innkeeper and reception staff were very friendly and accommodating. They gave us directions to attractions and even printed them out for us. They also printed out our boarding passes. The room or suite is incredibly spacious with a sink, fridge, coffee maker, FREE wi-fi, and a flat screen TV in a separate living room. The TV has netflix selections and cable. It was nice to be able to stay up late and watch TV without bothering my sleeping husband. Speaking of sleeping, the bed is so comfortable with nice soft linens. In the bathroom, there is a whirlpool tub and separate shower. The bathroom was huge. If all this is not enough, there is a complimentary breakfast which you can either eat in their rooftop restaurant or in your room. We ate in our roo, but we ate dinner at the restaurant and were not disappointed. The Greek Romaine salad was so delicious. I am still thinking of it. This place is a must see and a must stay. It is a great new addition to Baltimore having I guess just opened in May. Avoid the Inner Harbor crowds and stay here. Did I mention that it is right next to Little Italy which has great dining options also. You can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay!”
Reviews.Author: Larthur
Reviews.Content: We stumbled upon the black olive inn when coming to baltimore for a concert. The staff are so friendly, everyone is awesome. The room that we had was spacious, clean and had a good view. We were able to walk to attractions and restaurants. We had our service dog with us, and the inn accommodated every need for her. It was one of the best places we've stayed at, we will tell our friends about it and we will definitely be back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Inn”
Reviews.Author: mary h
Reviews.Content: This amazing quaint Inn in the heart of the East Harbour in Baltimore is simply fantastic. The service is first class, the food to die for and the suites are pristine. Every little detail is thought of before you get a chance to request. I would highly recommend. This is a different experience that delights all senses. A must stay . Mary

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful "Green" Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: FrankIlardi
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the Inn for business. This boutique hotel, and the wonderful restaurant upstairs, focus on "green" technology and organic foods and products. Dimitri and his mother (the owners) are very hospitable. The food is absolutely delicious, and the rooms are large and comfortable. I look forward to returning each time I am in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and a great experience!”
Reviews.Author: H J
Reviews.Content: The hotel is modern and green with attractive decor and comfortable furnishings. I was sad to only stay one night because I wanted more time to lay in the super comfortable bed or soak in the jacuzzi tub. The staff was helpful and accommodating and worked to make my stay a fantastic one. A complimentary bottle of wine was a nice touch too. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a unique experience and superior service.

Reviews.Title: “A Mediteranean Island Escape in Baltimore - Don't Think of Staying Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: LCVWG
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 glorious nights at the new Inn at the Black Olive in Baltimore, close to the Inner Harbor. It is a small new boutique hotel with fewer than 15 guest suites. Arriving at the inn the first night was as if I had been transported magically to the Mediterranean coast and was staying in a lovely private villa. The textures, colors and decor (including the vibrant soft handmade carpets) of the inn are natural and restful and soothe away all stress. The bed, linens, towels and other accoutrements are of the highest quality and wrap the guests in a bubble of luxury, comfort and peace. The bathroom is on a par with a spa with an enromous whirlpool bathtub and even larger shower. The flat screen tv did everything but jump off the wall and dance around the room. And of course the complimentary bottle of wine from the region after which your suite is named was most welcome. And then there was the complimentary breakfast which was specially prepared with perfect eggs, with homemade fresh warm toast, homemade marmalade, goart cheese, strawberries and blueberries. To find such a feast with such attentive personal service at a hotel is remarkable in itself. That it was included in the room charge is amazing. This is a hidden gem and very close to Johns Hopkins Hospital if you are visiting there.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what you would want from a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jehramie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here along with another couple on a mini vacation. Our room was the vip corner suite which was beautiful, the room our friends had was a slightly smaller suite, but still had all the same amenities. The wine was very good, and the selection was both large and interesting. Prices were surprisingly low for what i felt was great quality. The free bottle in your rooms was a nice touch. The location of the hotel is great, as it is right next to the fells point area for shopping and nightlife, but not smack in the middle of it. The best part of the stay was the staff. I have traveled a lot and normally stay in higher end hotels and suites, this was by far the most attentive and genuinely concerned staff I've ever dealt with. where i stay is very important part of my trips, and i hate starting with boring disinterested check in personnel. every employee we talked to was very helpful and a pleasure to deal with. I will stay here every time i am in the harbor area from now on. I think the only thing i wasn't completely happy with was the balconies. there were 2 in our room, one from the bedroom and one from the sitting area. I had pictured something a little larger. These were more of small lookout areas. To be clear, I wasn't promised anything about the balconies, just pictured something different,. Still, it wasn't so bad having 2 balconies to look out over the harbor from. :) We did not have the opportunity to try the restaurant in the Hotel unfortunately. but we plan to on our next trip. The Inn at the black olive is exactly what you would want from a hotel, and if you travel to the Baltimore inner harbor or fells point area, I promise you will be disappointed if you stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Hurricane Irene in the lap of luxury !”
Reviews.Author: lrmdell
Reviews.Content: We are three women with an adventureous spirit who braved Hurricanine Irene to stay at the Inn at the Black Olive. We were in the VIP suite( where Woody Harrellson stays),plenty of room, great views of the City and Storm! The Chef prepared dinner for just the guests in the Inn and it was fabulous. Dimitri can really make and Organic drink, and Ryan is a sweetheart. Breakfast was delicious - I think we tried all the choices! I especially liked the greek yougurt and the hand squeezed orange juice. They took very good care of us and we learned much about the green building and organic foods. Sure the service was slow - but it's dinner . . . why rush ! Dimitri went out on the deck of the 5th floor to gather fresh herbs for our drinks and dinner. The baby yellow and red tomatos in the Bloody Mary were to die for - we asked for more and got them! Sparkling Clean, Dining Room Table, Full size stainless steel frig, washer dryer combo (with Eco-detergent) automatic lights, Google TV, WI-FI, and fab towels, robes and slippers. Huge shower and jacuzzi tub - what more could you ask for - oh - the best most comfortable bed! The staff called cabs for us, and even came out to help with the packages. Less than a mile walk to Little Italy - and a beautiful promenade along the harbour that begins right across the street from the hotel. We'll go again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “One of a kind experience”
Reviews.Author: ecotraveler526
Reviews.Content: The Inn at The Black Olive has got to be one of the most eco-elegant hotels in America. The attention to detail in building the inn to a high sustainable standard is unmatched and at the same time the comfort and amenities are uncompromisingly high. The neighborhood was quiet but at the same time within walking distance of Baltimore's Inner Harbor. Parking was easy and the service was amazing. It will be a regular stop when I am in Baltimore.

HotelInfo.Name: Inn at The Black Olive
HotelInfo.Address: 803 South Caroline St, Fells Point, Baltimore, MD 21231
